docblock.description: This class represents a complete HTML document.
docblock.long-description:
It offers convenience functions for getting and setting elements of the document such as setTitle(), getTitle(), setMeta($name, $value), getBody().

It uses HtmlPageCrawler to navigate and manipulate the DOM tree.

docblock.description: Get a HtmlPageCrawler object containing the root node of the HTML document
Get a DOMDocument object for the HTML document
Sets the page title of the HTML document
Get the page title of the HTML document
Set a META tag with specified 'name' and 'content' attributes

tag.name: TODO
tag.description: : add support for multiple meta tags with the same name but different languages

docblock.description: Remove all meta tags with the specified name attribute
Get the content attribute of a meta tag with the specified name attribute
Set the base tag with href attribute set to parameter $url
Get the href attribute from the base tag, null if not present in document
Sets innerHTML content of an element specified by elementId
Get the document's HEAD section as DOMElement
Get the document's body as DOMElement
Get the document's HEAD section wrapped in a HtmlPageCrawler instance
Get the document's body wrapped in a HtmlPageCrawler instance
Save this document to a HTML file or return HTML code as string

tag.name: param
tag.description: If provided, output will be saved to this file, otherwise returned

docblock.description: Get an element in the document by it's id attribute
Filter nodes by using a CSS selector
Filter nodes by XPath expression
remove newlines from string and minimize whitespace (multiple whitespace characters replaced by one space)
docblock.long-description: useful for cleaning up text retrieved by HtmlPageCrawler::text() (nodeValue of a DOMNode)

docblock.description: Get an HtmlPageCrawler object from a HTML string, DOMNode, DOMNodeList or HtmlPageCrawler
docblock.long-description: This is the equivalent to jQuery's $() function when used for wrapping DOMNodes or creating DOMElements from HTML code.

docblock.description: Get the innerHTML contents of the first element
Get the HTML code fragment of all elements and their contents.
docblock.long-description: If the first node contains a complete HTML document return only the full code of this document.

docblock.description: checks whether the first node contains a complete html document (as opposed to a document fragment)
get ownerDocument of the first element
Delete all nodes in the list.
docblock.long-description:
Removes the nodes from DOM.

(as opposed to Crawler::clear() which detaches the nodes only from Crawler but leaves them in the DOM)

docblock.description: Set the HTML contents of each element
Sets an attribute on each element
Returns the attribute value of the first node of the list.
docblock.long-description: Alias for Crawler::attr() for equivalence with setAttribute()

docblock.description: Insert HTML content as child nodes of each element after existing children

tag.name: param
tag.description: HTML code fragment or DOMNode to append

docblock.description: Insert HTML content as child nodes of each element before existing children
Insert content, specified by the parameter, before each element in the set of matched elements.
Insert content, specified by the parameter, after each element in the set of matched elements.
Wrap an HTML structure around each element in the set of matched elements
docblock.long-description:
The HTML structure must contain only one root node, e.g.: Works:

Does not work:

docblock.description: Get or set the HTML contents
docblock.long-description: Function is here for compatibility with jQuery: When called with a parameter, it is equivalent to setInnerHtml(), without parameter it is the same as getInnerHtml()

tag.name: param
tag.description: The HTML content to set, or NULL to get the current content

tag.name: return
tag.description: If no param is provided, returns the HTML content of the first element

docblock.description: Get one CSS style property of the first element or set it for all elements in the list
docblock.long-description: Function is here for compatibility with jQuery; it is the same as getStyle() and setStyle()

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the style property

tag.name: param
tag.description: The CSS value to set, or NULL to get the current value

tag.name: return
tag.description: If no param is provided, returns the CSS styles of the first element

docblock.description: get one CSS style property of the first element
set one CSS style property for all elements in the list
Add a class to all elements in the list
Check whether the first element has a certain class
Remove a class from all elements in the list
Convert CSS string to array

tag.name: param
tag.description: list of CSS properties separated by ;

docblock.description: Convert CSS name->value array to string

tag.name: return
tag.description: list of CSS properties separated by ;

docblock.description: Removes all child nodes and text from all nodes in set
docblock.long-description: Equivalent to jQuery's empty() function which is not a valid function name in PHP

docblock.description: Filters the list of nodes with a CSS selector.
Filters the list of nodes with an XPath expression.

tag.name: return
tag.description: A new instance of Crawler with the filtered list of nodes

docblock.description: Adds HTML/XML content to the HtmlPageCrawler object (but not to the DOM of an already attached node).
docblock.long-description: Function overriden from Crawler because HTML fragments are always added as complete documents there

tag.name: param
tag.description: A string to parse as HTML/XML

tag.name: param
tag.description: The content type of the string

docblock.description: Helper function for getting a body element from an HTML fragment

tag.name: return
tag.description: The body node containing child nodes created from the HTML fragment

docblock.description: remove newlines from string and minimize whitespace (multiple whitespace characters replaced by one space) useful for cleaning up text retrieved by HtmlPageCrawler::text() (nodeValue of a DOMNode)
returns the first node
returns the node name of the first node
Insert every element in the set of matched elements to the end of the target.
Create a deep copy of the set of matched elements.
Insert every element in the set of matched elements after the target.
Insert every element in the set of matched elements before the target.
Insert every element in the set of matched elements to the beginning of the target.
Replace each target element with the set of matched elements.
Replace each element in the set of matched elements with the provided new content and return the set of elements that was removed.
Add or remove one or more classes from each element in the set of matched elements, depending on either the classs presence or the value of the switch argument.

tag.name: param
tag.description: One or more classnames separated by spaces

docblock.description: Remove the parents of the set of matched elements from the DOM, leaving the matched elements in their place.
Wrap an HTML structure around all elements in the set of matched elements.
Wrap an HTML structure around the content of each element in the set of matched elements.
Adds a node to the current list of nodes.
docblock.long-description:
This method uses the appropriate specialized add*() method based on the type of the argument.

Overwritten from parent to allow Crawler to be added
